com.enterprise_architecture.essential.widgets
Class AutoTextWidget

java.lang.Object
  java.awt.Component
      java.awt.Container
          javax.swing.JComponent
              javax.swing.JPanel
                  edu.stanford.smi.protege.widget.AbstractWidget
                      edu.stanford.smi.protege.widget.AbstractSlotWidget
                          edu.stanford.smi.protege.widget.TextComponentWidget
                              edu.stanford.smi.protege.widget.TextFieldWidget
                                  com.enterprise_architecture.essential.widgets.AutoTextWidget
All Implemented Interfaces:
edu.stanford.smi.protege.plugin.Plugin, edu.stanford.smi.protege.util.Disposable, edu.stanford.smi.protege.util.Selectable, edu.stanford.smi.protege.widget.SlotWidget, edu.stanford.smi.protege.widget.Widget, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible
public class AutoTextWidget
extends edu.stanford.smi.protege.widget.TextFieldWidget

Text widget that can be used to automatically create slot values based on the values of other slots in the class. In addition, static text prefixes, suffixes and separators can be included in the text that is automatically created.
Works with Protege version 3.1 to 3.4

Since:
version 1.0
Version:
1.1 - 18.03.2007. Fixed issue where using an Instance as an AutoText slot didn't work when creating a new instance., 1.1.1 - 15.10.2007. Added the dispose() method to release listeners to other slots, 1.1.2 - 15.01.2008. Resolved missing update events in client-server mode., 1.2 - 08.12.2008. Refactored package name., 1.3 - 20.04.2009. Revised getSlotWidgetInstance() to work with Protege 3.4
Author:
Jonathan W. Carter
See Also:
Serialized Form

isSuitable

public static boolean isSuitable(edu.stanford.smi.protege.model.Cls theClass,
                                 edu.stanford.smi.protege.model.Slot theSlot,
                                 edu.stanford.smi.protege.model.Facet facet)
Is this slot widget suitable for use with the selected slot?

Parameters:
theClass - the class that contains the slot
theSlot - the slot that wants to use this widget
facet - historical, always null.
Returns:
true if theSlot in question is a String text slot that has single cardinality.

setValues

public void setValues(java.util.Collection values)
Set the value for the slot that this widget is representing. Register FrameListeners on this ClassWidget of this widget and also on the Instances of Slots that contain Instance types to get updates of the text to be used in the creation of the auto text. The browser text for this widget (the text that appears in this widget on the user interface) is updated and then the value of the instance that this widget is displaying is updated with the new auto text.

Overrides:
setValues in class edu.stanford.smi.protege.widget.TextComponentWidget
Parameters:
values - the list of values that this slot contains. Take the 1st and compare it to the newly created auto-text. If they differ, take the new value. This method only executes if this widget is showing, to handle cases such as where auto text appears in InstanceLists.

createWidgetConfigurationPanel

public edu.stanford.smi.protege.widget.WidgetConfigurationPanel createWidgetConfigurationPanel()

a new instance of AutoTextConfigurationPanel

isSlotUsed

protected boolean isSlotUsed(edu.stanford.smi.protege.model.Slot theChangedSlot)
Is the specified slot - typically a Slot received in a FrameEvent - used by this AutoText?

Parameters:
theChangedSlot - the Slot to test
Returns:
true if theChangedSlot matches one of the Slots used in the auto-text template; false otherwise or if theChangedSlot is NULL.
See Also:
AutoTextListener, FrameEvent

Parameters:

Returns:

slotsHaveInstances

private boolean slotsHaveInstances()
See if the slots have been filled out with instances yet.

Returns:
true if Slots to be used in the auto-text have instances available

isSlotAndInstanceConsistent

private boolean isSlotAndInstanceConsistent(edu.stanford.smi.protege.model.Slot theSlot)
Check to see that the specified slot is in the AutoText pattern for this widget instance and that this is consistent with whether or not there is an instance of the SlotWidget for the specified Slot in the ClsWidget that is the parent of this AutoText widget. Therefore, if the Slot is being used, there should be an Instance. If the Slot is not being used, there shouldn't be an Instance. In addition, during this check, listeners are added to the Instances of the Slots that have Instances.

Parameters:
theSlot - the slot that is being tested for having an instance
Returns:
true if there is an instance, false if either the Slot is NULL (it is not being used in this AutoText pattern OR false if there is no Instance of a SlotWidget for theSlot, e.g. because it has not been created yet.

addSlotTextListener

private void addSlotTextListener(edu.stanford.smi.protege.model.Instance theSlotInstance)
Add a listener for changes to an instance of a slot that is in the AutoText configuration. If the listener is already listening to this instance no action is taken.

Parameters:
theSlotInstance - the instance of the Slot

getSlotWidgetInstance

private edu.stanford.smi.protege.model.Instance getSlotWidgetInstance()
Return a handle to the Instance of the AutoText SlotWidget, using a call to getInstance();
This is a revised version of the original method and is required to work with Protege 3.4.
Thanks to Tania Tudorace of the Protege Team for pointing this out and to Timothy Redmond (also of the Protege Team) for his help in tracing this problem.

Returns:
a reference to Instance of this AutoText SlotWidget.
Since:
version 1.3 - 20.04.2009 refactored to remove parameter

findSlotInstanceText

private java.lang.String findSlotInstanceText(edu.stanford.smi.protege.model.Instance theInstanceFrame,
                                              edu.stanford.smi.protege.model.Slot theTemplateSlot)
Find the text shown in the slot.

Parameters:
theInstanceFrame - the slot/instance that needs to be used
theTemplateSlot - the slot that theInstanceFrame is an instance of.
Returns:
the text value displayed for the instance of the slot

loadSlotFromName

private edu.stanford.smi.protege.model.Slot loadSlotFromName(java.lang.String theSlotName)
Get a reference to the specified Slot

Parameters:
theSlotName - the name of the slot that is being loaded
Returns:
a reference to the slot OR NULL if the named slot is not found

loadStringComponent

private java.lang.String loadStringComponent(java.lang.String theStringName)
Return the reference to the specified String from the properties The property value for nothing selected is translated to the empty string.

Parameters:
theStringName - the value of the property for the string configuration item
Returns:
the configuration string that will be used in the AutoText

saveConfigItem

private void saveConfigItem(java.lang.String theStringComponent,
                            int thePosition)
Save the configuration String item to the specified position in the AutoText array template. E.g. saving to position 2 will set the AutoText.Component.String_2 property to the specfied String value

Parameters:
theStringComponent - the String value that has been configured
thePosition - the position in the AutoText template for this String. Note, the prefix (if used) is a position 0, the suffix at position 5.

saveConfigItem

private void saveConfigItem(edu.stanford.smi.protege.model.Slot theSlotComponent,
                            int thePosition)
Save the configuration Slot item to the specified position in the AutoText array template. E.g. saving to position 2 will set the AutoText.Component.Slot_2 property to the name of the specfied Slot.

Parameters:
theSlotComponent - the Slot value that has been configured
thePosition - thePosition the position in the AutoText template for this Slot.

registerAutoTextListeners

private void registerAutoTextListeners()
Register the listeners for this widget. These listeners catch events when the slot values change on the Frame in which this widget exists. In addition, for Slots that are Instances of classes, an additional listener is registered to make sure that changes to slots in the Instance's Class are also received. E.g. the CreateNewInstance case.

Since:
v1.1

addSlotInstanceListener

private void addSlotInstanceListener(edu.stanford.smi.protege.model.Slot theTemplateSlot)
Add listeners to Slots that hold instances. This is required to ensure that changes to the Slots in a Class Instance are picked up when they are used as an Instance field on the Form (of this AutoTextWidget) and are used as part of an AutoText template. A listener is only added to Slots that hold Instances.

Parameters:
theTemplateSlot - a template slot on the AutoText's parent Form.

resetAutoText

public void resetAutoText()
Reset the ArrayList holding the autotext configuration to an empty configuration.

getItsAutoText

public java.util.ArrayList getItsAutoText()
Get a handle to the AutoText configuration ArrayList. The AutoText is stored as components in order. Elements in the ArrayList are either String or Slot types.

Returns:
the itsAutoText
